bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington

div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, WESTERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of Moye Wah, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
State of washington, ) County of Pierce :ss. County of Pierce
Thomas Hawks being first duly sworn on his oath deposes and says:-

That he is and has been for a number of years last past a citizen and resident of and freeholder of the City of Portland, Multnomah County, Oregon, and was for a number of years, deputy sheriff and a member of the police force of said city, and has for three years last past been deputy tax collector, engaged in the collection of taxes in said city; that he is the identical person who signed as Capt. Thomas Hawks the statement in the foregoing exhibit "A" attached to the certificate of wah Ni Moy Wah as ac- knowledged on the 22nd day of January, A.D., 1892 before J.E. Marks, Notary Public; that he is well and personally acquainted with said Moy Wah, and has, at different times, collected taxes of him and called at his place of business which is 168 Fifth Street Portland; that the said Moy Way is a member of the firm of Gum Wing Chung & Co., at said number; and deponent further says that owing to the fact that he was assigned, in the performance of his duties both as policeman and tax collector, to the district oc- cupied by the Chinese, he has, at different times been called up- on to sign statements for Chinamen who were intending to go to China and return to the United States; and deponent further says that he is duly informed and verily believes that the said Moy Wah is a member of said firm of Gum Chung Wing Chung & Co., de- ponent having at various times seen said Moy Wah engaged in work- ing about and employed in said place of business of said firm in Portland, and deponent has examined the original of said certifi-

cates and knows the contents thereof andsays that each and every statement therein contained is true to the best knowledge and be- lief of deponent; and deponent further says that said Moy Wah did depart and go to China at and about the time of his obtaining said certificate and that he verily believes that he went there for the sole purpose of further aiding and assisting in the carrying on of said business of said firm as aforesaid, as represented by said Moy Wah in said certificate, and deponent verily believes that said Moy Wah is a good, respectable and bona fide Chinese merchant of the United States and has been for three or more years last past, deponent stating upon oath that he has known him for at least that long including the period of his said absence from the United States, and deponent is duly informed and verily believes that at this time he has an interest in and is one of the joint owners of the business as carried on by said firm and is a good, honest, upright and bona fide Chinese merchant as aforesaid.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 6th day of June, 1893
Notary Public in and for Pierce County Residing at Tacoma, Washington.
